block.p: Deborah Marjorie Wallace, a daughter of Kathleen and Stratford Wallace of Greenwich, Conn., was married yesterday to Christopher James Ruddy, the son of Cathey and Richard Ruddy of Baldwin, N.Y. The Rev. Brian E. Daley performed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of St. Ignatius Loyola in New York.

Mrs. Ruddy, 33, is to begin this September as the director of the Catholic social teaching and Catholic education program at the University of St. Thomas, in St. Paul. She graduated from Georgetown University and is a doctoral candidate in theology at Boston College. Her father is a lawyer and a trustee of the Wallace Partnership, a family real estate company in New York.

The Rev. Brian E. Daley performed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of St. Ignatius Loyola in New York.

Mrs. Ruddy, 33, is to begin this September as the director of the Catholic social teaching and Catholic education program at the University of St. Thomas, in St. Paul. She graduated from Georgetown University and is a doctoral candidate in theology at Boston College. Her father is a lawyer and a trustee of the Wallace Partnership, a family real estate company in New York.

Mr. Ruddy, 29, is a doctoral candidate in theology at the University of Notre Dame and was until last month an editorial assistant at Commonweal magazine in New York. He graduated from Yale University and received a master's degree in theological studies from the Harvard Divinity School. His mother is a nurse at North Shore University Hospital, in Manhasset, N.Y. His father, a dentist, practices in Rockville Centre, N.Y.
